author: bmwlego
title: Chicken Racer
review: Another garage sale find, this set has green slopes and bricks, some of my earliest green elements added to my brick collection. This is not a bad looking car considering it is a Happy Meal giveaway. The chicken slope is printed and you get 2 sets of wheels. When will LEGO give sets away like this (or at least regular non-Biionicle sets) in Happy Meals in America?

author: legocarnut2
title: Pretty Good for a Happy Meal Toy...
review:
Pros: Good parts, rare printed chicken head green slope piece, good wheels, uncommon pieces, OK to play with with if you are a kid since it is like a Hot Wheels Car...

Cons: Bad Build (which is expected), Not much to do with if you are not a kid.

Sum-Up: Good for a Happy Meal toy, not so great for a Lego set.

author: Pepper
title: nothing better than free legos!
review:
This is a set that was available from McDonalds back in 1998. It mostly includes normal bricks, plates, and slopes, along with some wheels.

Pros

  • printed brick
  • usefull basic parts

Cons

  • boring build

This set is not very good, but what can you expect from a freebie? The only thing mildly interesting is the brick with the McDonalds chicken, whose name eludes me, that is printed on it. I would not reccommend it, unless you can find it for dirt cheap.
